intro: Hibbertia ericifolia subsp. acutifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves and produces yellow flowers with distinctive, elongated petals. The plant typically grows in heathland and coastal environments, preferring well-drained soils. It is part of the Dilleniaceae family and is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in harsh conditions. Hibbertia ericifolia subsp. acutifolia is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
